verses.verse: (PSALM 3) (Morning Prayer of Trust in God.) (A Psalm of David, when he fled from his son Absalom.) (2 Sam 15:13-17, 29) LORD, how my enemies have increased! Many are rising up against me.
Many are saying of my soul, “There is no salvation for him in God.” Selah
But You, LORD, are a shield around me, My glory, and the One who lifts my head.
I was crying out to the LORD with my voice, And He answered me from His holy (Or hill) mountain. Selah
(Or As for me, I) I lay down and slept; I awoke, for the LORD sustains me.
I will not be afraid of ten thousands of people Who have set themselves against me all around.
Arise, LORD; save me, my God! For You (Or strike) have struck all my enemies on the (Or jaw) cheek; You (Or shatter) have shattered the teeth of the wicked.
(Or Deliverance) Salvation belongs to the LORD; May Your blessing (Or is) be upon Your people! Selah
